column1: '''An Evening in Tavrobel''' is a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and published in [[1924]] within the ''[[Leeds University Verse 1914-24]]'' on page 56.<ref>{{webcite
column7: accessed=29 July 2013}}</ref> It was probably written a few years earlier, in [[1916]] or [[1917]]. The poem recounts an evening in [[Tavrobel]], a place beyond the rivers [[Gruir]] and [[Afros]], where lived the elf [[Gilfanon]].<ref name=AH/>

column1: The poem has been reprinted in ''[[Three Early Poems]]'' (1991),<ref>{{webcite
column8: ''Amon Hen'' 242]] (2013), together with commentary by Fernando Cid Lucas and Bernardo Santano Moreno.<ref name=AH>Fernando Cid Lucas and Bernardo Santano Moreno, "El Poema ''An Evening in Tavrobel'' de J.R.R. Tolkien", in [[Amon Hen 242
